Having OS::TripleO::Tasks::PackageUpdate with a SoftwareDeployment
interface instead of SoftwareConfig interface will allow us to do
multi-step operations within PackageUpdate resource (multiple
SoftwareDeployment resources within the nested stack).

This is important to be able to do Controller upgrades using the
PackageUpdate hook.

Change-Id: I711163e1a668a696bfaf3dcfd0065353a4cc72ed
'}]
commit_message:
SoftwareDeployment interface for OS::TripleO::Tasks::PackageUpdate

Having OS::TripleO::Tasks::PackageUpdate with a SoftwareDeployment
interface instead of SoftwareConfig interface will allow us to do
multi-step operations within PackageUpdate resource (multiple
SoftwareDeployment resources within the nested stack).

This is important to be able to do Controller upgrades using the
PackageUpdate hook.

Change-Id: I711163e1a668a696bfaf3dcfd0065353a4cc72ed

subject: Switch to IPA as a primary ramdisk for ironic-inspector jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-24 12:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch to IPA as a primary ramdisk for ironic-inspector jobs

It proved very stable, and we plan on deprecating the old ramdisk, so:
1. make -ipa job voting
2. switch ironic and ironic-inspector-client to using the IPA job
3. -dib job is left voting but is removed from the gate pipeline,
   as it accesses internet and thus is affected by mirror problems.

Change-Id: I2909b59802f07ad2f9c8ed83c1f965b440cfc022
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to IPA as a primary ramdisk for ironic-inspector jobs

It proved very stable, and we plan on deprecating the old ramdisk, so:
1. make -ipa job voting
2. switch ironic and ironic-inspector-client to using the IPA job
3. -dib job is left voting but is removed from the gate pipeline,
   as it accesses internet and thus is affected by mirror problems.

Change-Id: I2909b59802f07ad2f9c8ed83c1f965b440cfc022

subject: Ensure JSON sent over websocket is a dictionary
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 12321, 'name': 'Ryan Brown', 'email': 'rybrown@redhat.com', 'username': 'ryansb'}, {'_account_id': 15054, 'name': 'wangxiyuan', 'email': 'wangxiyuan1007@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangxiyuan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-26 03:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/transport/websocket/protocol.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/transport/websocket/test_protocol.py'], 'message': 'Ensure JSON sent over websocket is a dictionary

The json lib in python can transform the input into many kinds of
data struct, such as int,str,boolean and so on. But only dict can
be handled by websocket. Now if the input is not dict like, the
zaqar-server will be stop at all. So before handle the request,
we should ensure the input format is acceptable.

Closes-bug: #1537965
Change-Id: I4e8bf4c0477741b40df3c58abb32ba73c792256c
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure JSON sent over websocket is a dictionary

The json lib in python can transform the input into many kinds of
data struct, such as int,str,boolean and so on. But only dict can
be handled by websocket. Now if the input is not dict like, the
zaqar-server will be stop at all. So before handle the request,
we should ensure the input format is acceptable.

Closes-bug: #1537965
Change-Id: I4e8bf4c0477741b40df3c58abb32ba73c792256c

Change-Id: Ia2298733188b3d964d43a547504ede2ebeaba9bd

commit_message:
Using dict.items() is better than six.iteritems(dict)

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was preferred in the past,
but there was a discussion suggesting to avoid six for this[1].
The overhead of creating a temporary list on Python 2 is negligible.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html
Partially-implements blueprint py3-compatibility

Change-Id: Ia2298733188b3d964d43a547504ede2ebeaba9bd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

commit_message:
Move osprofiler tests into osprofiler

To follow the pattern that nearly all oslo tests follow
move the tests out of the osprofiler root directory and into
the osprofiler module itself.

This makes it easier for new people to get involved and follows
the more common directory structure that people should already
be used to.

Change-Id: I384cdb5466d852dd4493e4fce2f0078545724416

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 12:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_logs.py', 'tempest/cmd/verify_tempest_config.py'], 'message': 'Replace exit() by sys.exit()

exit() is used for interactive shell, it relies on the site module.
sys.exit() is considered good to use in programs.

Trivial-fix

Change-Id: I9e6e7a53581abefbb6cc3ba6ee6b853cd430d456

commit_message:
Replace exit() by sys.exit()

exit() is used for interactive shell, it relies on the site module.
sys.exit() is considered good to use in programs.

Trivial-fix

Change-Id: I9e6e7a53581abefbb6cc3ba6ee6b853cd430d456

subject: Skip already processed measurements
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-26 13:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py'], 'message': 'Skip already processed measurements

When using multiple workers, the list of metrics to process
could possibly include those that have already been
procesed by other workers.  This causes the worker to do
extra processing.

This patch addresses this by ensuring that there is
measurements in the system first before starting to
process it.

Change-Id: I0307d3ca679c087d141db6bd02d8de1706298bbb
Partial-Bug: #1536909
'}]
commit_message:
Skip already processed measurements

When using multiple workers, the list of metrics to process
could possibly include those that have already been
procesed by other workers.  This causes the worker to do
extra processing.

This patch addresses this by ensuring that there is
measurements in the system first before starting to
process it.

Change-Id: I0307d3ca679c087d141db6bd02d8de1706298bbb
Partial-Bug: #1536909

to take a hash of key/value pairs, in addition to a comma-
delimited list as a string.

Also better handle existing metadata values which contain
commas.

Change-Id: I148def3be059d87fa9aa8f748cd3a5ec7770473a
Closes-bug: 1534853

subject: use oslo.utils.reflection extract the class name

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-16 02:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/cdh/client/types.py'], 'message': 'use oslo.utils.reflection extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
of where a class name may come from (on python 2 or python 3) so its
usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might as well use it.

Change-Id: Ibb3387ce4e6ed901f06bc1c1bbcd46317366f532
'}]
commit_message:
use oslo.utils.reflection extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
of where a class name may come from (on python 2 or python 3) so its
usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might as well use it.

Change-Id: Ibb3387ce4e6ed901f06bc1c1bbcd46317366f532

commit_message:
Add notes for LBaaS v2 + Horizon

The notes for enabling LBaaS don't mention that LBaaS v2 won't appear
in Horizon in the Liberty release. This patch also adds a reminder
for deployers to use the newer lbaas-* commands when using th v2 API.

Closes-bug: 1537840

Change-Id: Ie59c78c99886b1aa528c502ce2840ea4caa3bd0e

commit_message:
Update puppet-openstacklib module to current Mitaka version

Puppet-openstacklib module was synced with upstream (up to 7 Jan).
Only two custom patches are left:

* https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/10936/
  it will be reverted after MySql module update

* https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/12090/
  Fuel specific patch (shouldn't be upstreamed)

Additional changes for Mitaka puppet-openstacklib module:

* Don't set API version for auth url. Openstacklib providers
  will automatically use what's needed.

Change-Id: I8ab639757e8652507ef37804e1fc47501f2de493

subject: customize caching implementation for neutron_network
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-09 02:54:01.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_network/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_network/neutron.rb'], 'message': "customize caching implementation for neutron_network

Because of issue:

  https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-3656

in Puppet, exceptions from prefetch do not prevent resources
from being initialized. In the case of neutron, this
can lead to duplicate resource definitions b/c neutron
does not prevent users from creating duplicate objects.

In our test lab, the following is happening:

1. prefetch fails:

Could not prefetch neutron_network provider 'neutron': Execution of '/usr/bin/neutron net-show --format=shell 4d46e084-5d34-471c-ad11-2f9a7aacdee7' returned 1: Unable to establish connection to http://lb.keystone.service.consul:35357/v2.0/tokens

2. resources run anyways

3. since they cannot see the existing resources in the @property_hash
they keep on creating duplicate network entries.

This patch removes the issue by having each call to exists? call
a custom cache method (which is also called by instances). This
ensures that each resource instance will fail if the caching of
information fails. It also ensures that subsequent resources
rebuild the cache if previous resource instance of a provider
fail.

Change-Id: Iab966ad0d87ba20150d91d1fecd0a90e01b1b770
"}]
commit_message:
customize caching implementation for neutron_network

Because of issue:

  https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-3656

in Puppet, exceptions from prefetch do not prevent resources
from being initialized. In the case of neutron, this
can lead to duplicate resource definitions b/c neutron
does not prevent users from creating duplicate objects.

In our test lab, the following is happening:

1. prefetch fails:

Could not prefetch neutron_network provider 'neutron': Execution of '/usr/bin/neutron net-show --format=shell 4d46e084-5d34-471c-ad11-2f9a7aacdee7' returned 1: Unable to establish connection to http://lb.keystone.service.consul:35357/v2.0/tokens

2. resources run anyways

3. since they cannot see the existing resources in the @property_hash
they keep on creating duplicate network entries.

This patch removes the issue by having each call to exists? call
a custom cache method (which is also called by instances). This
ensures that each resource instance will fail if the caching of
information fails. It also ensures that subsequent resources
rebuild the cache if previous resource instance of a provider
fail.

Change-Id: Iab966ad0d87ba20150d91d1fecd0a90e01b1b770

subject: customize caching implementation for neutron_network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 15:21:27.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_network/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_network/neutron.rb'], 'message': "customize caching implementation for neutron_network

Because of issue:

  https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-3656

in Puppet, exceptions from prefetch do not prevent resources
from being initialized. In the case of neutron, this
can lead to duplicate resource definitions b/c neutron
does not prevent users from creating duplicate objects.

In our test lab, the following is happening:

1. prefetch fails:

Could not prefetch neutron_network provider 'neutron': Execution of '/usr/bin/neutron net-show --format=shell 4d46e084-5d34-471c-ad11-2f9a7aacdee7' returned 1: Unable to establish connection to http://lb.keystone.service.consul:35357/v2.0/tokens

2. resources run anyways

3. since they cannot see the existing resources in the @property_hash
they keep on creating duplicate network entries.

This patch removes the issue by having each call to exists? call
a custom cache method (which is also called by instances). This
ensures that each resource instance will fail if the caching of
information fails. It also ensures that subsequent resources
rebuild the cache if previous resource instance of a provider
fail.

Also ensures that cahce is flushed during prefetch

and adds args to self.prefetch

Change-Id: I0db20461a66d3059bfe3dd70c22d8346d0ee016f
"}]
commit_message:
customize caching implementation for neutron_network

Because of issue:

  https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-3656

in Puppet, exceptions from prefetch do not prevent resources
from being initialized. In the case of neutron, this
can lead to duplicate resource definitions b/c neutron
does not prevent users from creating duplicate objects.

In our test lab, the following is happening:

1. prefetch fails:

Could not prefetch neutron_network provider 'neutron': Execution of '/usr/bin/neutron net-show --format=shell 4d46e084-5d34-471c-ad11-2f9a7aacdee7' returned 1: Unable to establish connection to http://lb.keystone.service.consul:35357/v2.0/tokens

2. resources run anyways

3. since they cannot see the existing resources in the @property_hash
they keep on creating duplicate network entries.

This patch removes the issue by having each call to exists? call
a custom cache method (which is also called by instances). This
ensures that each resource instance will fail if the caching of
information fails. It also ensures that subsequent resources
rebuild the cache if previous resource instance of a provider
fail.

Also ensures that cahce is flushed during prefetch

and adds args to self.prefetch

Change-Id: I0db20461a66d3059bfe3dd70c22d8346d0ee016f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-22 00:32:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/image/v2/test_images.py'], 'message': "There is no api for searching images with size

I read the code of the image and I could't find the api for searching
images with exact size.I have submitted some code of glance on the
list of images and I failed in the test of tempest.

The image name and the image size in glance can be repeated.And no
one will need to use the exact image size to query the image.It
is not supported in horizon,too.
So I think this test function should be deleted.

Change-Id: Ibfa1a2ce96516b015da907e0826ca259bf15078b
Closes-Bug: #1536449
"}]
commit_message:
There is no api for searching images with size

I read the code of the image and I could't find the api for searching
images with exact size.I have submitted some code of glance on the
list of images and I failed in the test of tempest.

The image name and the image size in glance can be repeated.And no
one will need to use the exact image size to query the image.It
is not supported in horizon,too.
So I think this test function should be deleted.

Change-Id: Ibfa1a2ce96516b015da907e0826ca259bf15078b
Closes-Bug: #1536449

commit_message:
Raise IdentityError if auth_url doesn't exist

Otherwise a TypeError, not understandable for the user, is raised. This
happens for example when using tempest account-generator with no
identity uri defined in the config file.

Also added unit tests for this specific case.

Change-Id: Ia8d523f973240300e0010b9b28f5ee63b2b84341

_assert_exception() is expected to catch the case where an exception

Closes-bug: #1537892

commit_message:
Fix _assert_exception()

_assert_exception() is expected to catch the case where an exception
with certain data must be thrown out. But it misses the case that no
exception is thrown. This patch fixes the bug.

Change-Id: Ia51e12d171512db4e9bc6fc1dd3eb66c951051e8
Closes-bug: #1537892

commit_message:
Move CNA Event Handler to Agent Base

As we evaluate bringing new Neutron agents in for the PowerVM platform,
the CNA Event Handler is seen as needed by those agents (to identify
when a new request comes in).

This refactoring moves the Event Handler up to the base class so that
other agents can make use of it.

Change-Id: I2a6891a1332834808ff9dfc493c32d10fc39dd64

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-05 10:10:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: fix disk I/O QOS support with RBD

The disk I/O QOS settings were set in the libvirt_info
method of the Image class. While this is fine for most
subclasses, the Rbd subclass overrides this method and
so was loosing the QOS settings. Move the setting of
QOS parameters into a separate method so it can be
called in all places that need it. For added fun the
commit 86e6f34 which added QOS settings originally never
added any unit tests to cover its operation.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Fixes bug #1405367
Change-Id: Ibb3a4dff8996c29ef921be7c56648a442bbb89a2
(cherry picked from commit fdb7b030abbff85d19581c3f2b0ba68683fd8d6f)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix disk I/O QOS support with RBD

The disk I/O QOS settings were set in the libvirt_info
method of the Image class. While this is fine for most
subclasses, the Rbd subclass overrides this method and
so was loosing the QOS settings. Move the setting of
QOS parameters into a separate method so it can be
called in all places that need it. For added fun the
commit 86e6f34 which added QOS settings originally never
added any unit tests to cover its operation.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Fixes bug #1405367
Change-Id: Ibb3a4dff8996c29ef921be7c56648a442bbb89a2
(cherry picked from commit fdb7b030abbff85d19581c3f2b0ba68683fd8d6f)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-24 09:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/common/exception.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/filters.py', 'senlin/common/schema.py', 'senlin/api/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Using dict.items() is better than six.iteritems(dict)

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was

commit_message:
Using dict.items() is better than six.iteritems(dict)

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was
preferred in the past, but there was a discussion
suggesting to avoid six for this[1].

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I949e3a529b0649674e44f54a1a9322a1a7f1831c

subject: Add debug testenv in tox
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-16 03:58:27.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug" to
debug test cases when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest
which really debug our test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.
This starts up the debugger pdb at the point of failure
so that we can look at the program environment,
inspect variables, single step, etc.

usage link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I7d33ab10e6ebbcaa90357edd025e1be5d9fbfe17
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug" to
debug test cases when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest
which really debug our test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.
This starts up the debugger pdb at the point of failure
so that we can look at the program environment,
inspect variables, single step, etc.

usage link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I7d33ab10e6ebbcaa90357edd025e1be5d9fbfe17

subject: Mutable defalut argument found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-16 06:11:36.000000000', 'files': ['cue/api/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'Mutable defalut argument found

Python’s default arguments are evaluated once
when the function is defined, not each time the function is called.

This means that if you use a mutable default argument
and mutate it, you will and have mutated that object
for all future calls to the function as well.

more details about this wrong usage here:
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments

Change-Id: I8b82f74962776aaca75b28581a8822b67f49ad1e
'}]
commit_message:
Mutable defalut argument found

Python’s default arguments are evaluated once
when the function is defined, not each time the function is called.

This means that if you use a mutable default argument
and mutate it, you will and have mutated that object
for all future calls to the function as well.

more details about this wrong usage here:
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments

Change-Id: I8b82f74962776aaca75b28581a8822b67f49ad1e

subject: Py3: Replace func.func_name with func.__name__

The func_name attribute has been removed in Python 3. Functions have the
__name__ attribute on Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I6eee382118e76990767ac88b9303cae0d6d983e2
'}]
commit_message:
Py3: Replace func.func_name with func.__name__

The func_name attribute has been removed in Python 3. Functions have the
__name__ attribute on Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I6eee382118e76990767ac88b9303cae0d6d983e2

commit_message:
Increase kernel.pid_max value for ceph-osd nodes

To meet Ceph requirements and eliminate accidental cascade
OSD node failures this commit increases kernel.pid_max
parameter during deploy ceph-osd nodes. Also this commit
contain some puppet-lint cleanups and validations for this
module.

Change-Id: I70a64ff7b85229bf0760be266302d9b32039989a
(cherry-picked from commit 2cec77da86f2148a9e256bd46d58aaad2de874ea)
Closes-Bug: #1536271
Closes-Bug: #1537084

After the upgrade of Gerrit the message field works as expected
so the review tool can use it instead of filtering using the
topic. This implies that having the bug number in the commit
message is enough for the patch to be included in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I6e61643fe862f842d731abaacfd1b18881e0c45e

commit_message:
Neutron review tool use message instead of topics for bugs

After the upgrade of Gerrit the message field works as expected
so the review tool can use it instead of filtering using the
topic. This implies that having the bug number in the commit
message is enough for the patch to be included in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I6e61643fe862f842d731abaacfd1b18881e0c45e

When the l2population mechanism driver is enabled, if ovs is restarted

commit_message:
Ensure that tunnels are fully reset on ovs restart

When the l2population mechanism driver is enabled, if ovs is restarted
tunnel ports are not re-configured in full due to stale ofport handles
in the OVS agent.

Reset all handles when OVS is restarted to ensure that tunnels are
fully recreated in this situation.

Change-Id: If0e034a034a7f000a1c58aa8a43d2c857dee6582
Closes-bug: #1460164

When an IPv6 subnet's ipv6_ra_mode is set to DHCPV6_STATEFUL,
the hosts on that subnet rely on router advertisement for the
prefix length. This is important for subnets where the lengths
of the prefixes are not 64.

Closes-Bug: #1531093
Change-Id: Ied8d390a05ee1a2e544e39e887abf11c8a56abc3
"}]
commit_message:
radvd prefix configuration for DHCPV6_Stateful RA

When an IPv6 subnet's ipv6_ra_mode is set to DHCPV6_STATEFUL,
the hosts on that subnet rely on router advertisement for the
prefix length. This is important for subnets where the lengths
of the prefixes are not 64.

Closes-Bug: #1531093
Change-Id: Ied8d390a05ee1a2e544e39e887abf11c8a56abc3

commit_message:
Remove unwanted NOTE from dvr_local_router

The NOTE in dvr_local_router about the 'fg' interface
removal  and the 'fip namespace' delete can be removed.

It was not removed when the server side rpc call was
implemented to delete the fip namespace.

Change-Id: If4f8c479791bdc63fdeaa9531aa8cbffd95b34ef

l3 agent logs for sometime.

This will be seen when multiple floatingips are created on
the same node for different routers or when a floatingip
is disassociated and re-associated to a fixed-ip on the same node.

The fip namespace is retained in the compute node even though
the floatingip is disassociated, but when we try to re-associate
or create a new floatingip the code in l3agent is trying to check,
if this is the 'first' floatingip and if so tries to re-create the
floatingip namespace and the rules within it.

This happens because we are unsubscribing the fip namespace count
for every associated routers that we are deleting.

This duplicate call to create the fip namespace should be restricted
if there is already a fip namespace in the compute node and the fip
namespace should be unsubscribed only when the external network is
removed before the actual fip namespace is deleted.

The change proposed in this fix, will only unsubscribe the fip
namespace before it is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1535928

Change-Id: I24016382091cad485f65e7753972f4b71702ff9f
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix Duplicate IPtables rule detected warning message in l3agent

Duplicate IPtables rule detected warning message is seen in the
l3 agent logs for sometime.

This will be seen when multiple floatingips are created on
the same node for different routers or when a floatingip
is disassociated and re-associated to a fixed-ip on the same node.

The fip namespace is retained in the compute node even though
the floatingip is disassociated, but when we try to re-associate
or create a new floatingip the code in l3agent is trying to check,
if this is the 'first' floatingip and if so tries to re-create the
floatingip namespace and the rules within it.

This happens because we are unsubscribing the fip namespace count
for every associated routers that we are deleting.

This duplicate call to create the fip namespace should be restricted
if there is already a fip namespace in the compute node and the fip
namespace should be unsubscribed only when the external network is
removed before the actual fip namespace is deleted.

The change proposed in this fix, will only unsubscribe the fip
namespace before it is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1535928

Change-Id: I24016382091cad485f65e7753972f4b71702ff9f

commit_message:
py3: Replaces xrange() with six.moves.range()

Since xrange has been removed in Python 3, this patch let's replace xrange()
with six.moves.range() to provide py3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I0d813f8f97e07eaa33077677e2f9baa6a1c5f0bb

commit_message:
Remove use of role_name variable

`role_name` is a reserved variable name. Instead, use the explicit
service_role_name variables when adding roles to users.

Change-Id: Ia5fa0e400aeec6d808891c5dd793ee8177d9b5f3

subject: Add checksum to image LU identification
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-22 18:07:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/__init__.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/driver.py'], 'message': "Add checksum to image LU identification

The SSP disk driver cleverly avoids uploading a particular glance image
to the SSP more than once by naming it such that it can be recognized
subsequently.  If the image LU thus named already exists in the SSP, we
reuse it (creating a linked clone for use by the instance being
deployed).

Previously, the naming convention for an image LU was
'image_%(sanitized_image_name)s', where the sanitized_image_name was
generated from the first 73 characters of the glance image name (79,
which is the default max filename size, minus the length of 'image_'),
scrubbed to replace any non-alphanumeric/period/underscore characters
with underscores.

This will cause problems whenever an image name is reused while the SSP
still contains the original image LU: the SSP disk driver will generate
the same name, find an image LU of that name in the SSP, and blithely
attach the deploying instance to a linked clone of that image, even
though it's not the same as the new one in glance.

To remedy this problem, with this change set we are now generating the
image LU name as 'image_%(sanitized_image_name)_%(image_checksum)s'.
The image_checksum is a 32-character hash that comes from ImageMeta.
The total length is still 79; so the 'sanitized_image_name' is now
limited to 40 characters.

Now, even when an image name is reused, the LU name will (with extremely
high probability, like reaching into your average star twice and getting
two different milligrams of matter) be different because the image's
checksum will be different; so we'll upload and use the new image
instead of the old one.

Change-Id: I465a90e7105d7d8a7ed1e0b30e96ee98a1d7dfdb
"}]
commit_message:
Add checksum to image LU identification

The SSP disk driver cleverly avoids uploading a particular glance image
to the SSP more than once by naming it such that it can be recognized
subsequently.  If the image LU thus named already exists in the SSP, we
reuse it (creating a linked clone for use by the instance being
deployed).

Previously, the naming convention for an image LU was
'image_%(sanitized_image_name)s', where the sanitized_image_name was
generated from the first 73 characters of the glance image name (79,
which is the default max filename size, minus the length of 'image_'),
scrubbed to replace any non-alphanumeric/period/underscore characters
with underscores.

This will cause problems whenever an image name is reused while the SSP
still contains the original image LU: the SSP disk driver will generate
the same name, find an image LU of that name in the SSP, and blithely
attach the deploying instance to a linked clone of that image, even
though it's not the same as the new one in glance.

To remedy this problem, with this change set we are now generating the
image LU name as 'image_%(sanitized_image_name)_%(image_checksum)s'.
The image_checksum is a 32-character hash that comes from ImageMeta.
The total length is still 79; so the 'sanitized_image_name' is now
limited to 40 characters.

Now, even when an image name is reused, the LU name will (with extremely
high probability, like reaching into your average star twice and getting
two different milligrams of matter) be different because the image's
checksum will be different; so we'll upload and use the new image
instead of the old one.

Change-Id: I465a90e7105d7d8a7ed1e0b30e96ee98a1d7dfdb

commit_message:
Moved filtration of tasks into TaskSerializer

Since expanding groups needs all tasks, the filtration of tasks was
moved into TaskSerializer.
To preserve connectivity of graph keep all task in graph, only mark it as skipped.

Change-Id: Icfbe0a9d49df2b4ac3e71f28424b7d99ecbb543a
Closes-Bug: #1529783
(cherry picked from commit 4026e2e0e1676b08f323d95503fbf9745974603e)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:14:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_bandit_conf_generator.py', 'bandit/bandit_config_generator.py'], 'message': 'Conf generator: allow users to disable blacklisted calls

Using the following syntax:

blacklist_calls:
    _bcg_remove_bad_name_sets: [random]

One may remove the "random" set from the blacklist calls. This is useful if the
project does not use "random" for anything crypto-related and just needs to
import random without being bothered by bandit.

Change-Id: Icf91cb07338803f1ff388fd8f9b8c243fb49ce71
'}]
commit_message:
Conf generator: allow users to disable blacklisted calls

Using the following syntax:

blacklist_calls:
    _bcg_remove_bad_name_sets: [random]

One may remove the "random" set from the blacklist calls. This is useful if the
project does not use "random" for anything crypto-related and just needs to
import random without being bothered by bandit.

Change-Id: Icf91cb07338803f1ff388fd8f9b8c243fb49ce71

commit_message:
Ensure Glance image 'size' attribute is 0, not 'None'

Make sure that if the 'size' attribute for an image does not
exist in Glance, that we set the value to 0 and not 'None'.
Glance does not accept 'None' as a valid value for the 'size'
attribute.

Co-Authored-By:Kevin_Zheng<zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8c6a8749d86a22eb2d2e1e84ce6a2b9a4a4992ee
Closes-bug: 1487742

commit_message:
Use source based balance for the A/P galera

Ensure sticky sessions based routing decisions
for clients connecting to the galera cluster active
node.
See for details:
http://blog.haproxy.com/2012/03/29/load-balancing-affinity-persistence-sticky-sessions-what-you-need-to-know/
https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/configuration-1.5.html#hash-type

Closes-bug: #1490595

Change-Id: Ia12cffd38008a930a9d1cf1db45a0d6591cae5cc
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

the measures retrieve requests. This patches fixes that.

commit_message:
Move getting the address scope on the Subnet to core

This is something I'd like to clean up but it will take some learning
and possibly some intrusive coding in the core.  I'm not sure yet what
direction to take.  Feedback welcome.  Also, if you think you can
knock this out, ping me and I'll let you take it.

Change-Id: I690b88455d5eb05c45fc6b2055a76b371826ca87
Partially-Implements: address-scopes

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-13 12:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_metadata.py', 'nova/api/metadata/handler.py'], 'message': 'Metadata: support proxying loadbalancers

Metadata service identified an instance by its IP address which is
stored in X-Forwarded-For header, and the attached router instance
which is stored in X-Metadata-Provider header.

A generic load balancer will not be able to insert the\xa0X-Instance-ID
which is identifying the metadata requesting instance.

To identify the instance, we use the following algorithm:
The load balancer adds an X-Forwared-For header to the HTTP header,
with the IP address of the instance. That is not enough to identify
the instance as we could have overlapping IPs.

The load balancer inserts an additional header - X-Metadata-Provider,
which identifies the load balancer. The load balancer is an IP device
and therefore cannot have overlapping IPs connected to it. So
X-Metadata-Provider with the X-Forwarded-For make a unique pair,
which is enough to identify the requesting instance.

X-Metadata-Provider-Signature is used to authenticate the load balancer,
in a similar way to X-Instance-ID-Signature with X-Instance-ID is
authenticated the metadata proxy requests.

DocImpact

Co-authored-by: Kobi Samoray <ksamoray@vmware.com>

This completes the blueprint vmware-nsxv-support

Conflicts:
	nova/api/metadata/handler.py

Change-Id: I3ab687913acd7301c76632de69c80116c2d99cf6
(cherry picked from commit 622a845b757aa35932f703963beffc764d8ae244)
'}]
commit_message:
Metadata: support proxying loadbalancers

Metadata service identified an instance by its IP address which is
stored in X-Forwarded-For header, and the attached router instance
which is stored in X-Metadata-Provider header.

A generic load balancer will not be able to insert the X-Instance-ID
which is identifying the metadata requesting instance.

To identify the instance, we use the following algorithm:
The load balancer adds an X-Forwared-For header to the HTTP header,
with the IP address of the instance. That is not enough to identify
the instance as we could have overlapping IPs.

The load balancer inserts an additional header - X-Metadata-Provider,
which identifies the load balancer. The load balancer is an IP device
and therefore cannot have overlapping IPs connected to it. So
X-Metadata-Provider with the X-Forwarded-For make a unique pair,
which is enough to identify the requesting instance.

X-Metadata-Provider-Signature is used to authenticate the load balancer,
in a similar way to X-Instance-ID-Signature with X-Instance-ID is
authenticated the metadata proxy requests.

DocImpact

Co-authored-by: Kobi Samoray <ksamoray@vmware.com>

This completes the blueprint vmware-nsxv-support

Conflicts:
	nova/api/metadata/handler.py

Change-Id: I3ab687913acd7301c76632de69c80116c2d99cf6
(cherry picked from commit 622a845b757aa35932f703963beffc764d8ae244)

commit_message:
Neutron: add in API method for updating VNIC index

The security group support for the VMware-NSXv Neutron plugin
requires that the Neutron port update the actual VNIC index of
the instance.

This patch adds the support for updating the VNIC index for the
Neutron port. This is done in two places:
1. When the instance is spawned
2. If and when a port is attached to a running instance

The Neutron support for the extension is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144278

This is part of the blueprint vmware-nsxv-support

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ie990fa1141a7b2bdae1883572969adef072f4358
(cherry picked from commit 92bc9abd6a611ec2a81ad2a18980ea0496166ccf)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-10-06 19:20:59.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/resource-capabilities.rst'], 'message': 'Add template capabilities

Outlines a plan for potentially enhancing HOT to support an optional
capabilities annotation, which is similar in concept to the
TOSCA substitution_mapping definition, although we only consider the
matching of capabilities in this spec (not specific resource types,
although a method for doing that is discussed).

The aim here is to enable easier composability, but providing built-in
support for compatible matching templates to resource_registry
mappings.

Change-Id: Ie1b3c564b38f929d587af7074c1327c495846e57
Co-Authored-By: Jay Dobies <jason.dobies@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add template capabilities

Outlines a plan for potentially enhancing HOT to support an optional
capabilities annotation, which is similar in concept to the
TOSCA substitution_mapping definition, although we only consider the
matching of capabilities in this spec (not specific resource types,
although a method for doing that is discussed).

The aim here is to enable easier composability, but providing built-in
support for compatible matching templates to resource_registry
mappings.

Change-Id: Ie1b3c564b38f929d587af7074c1327c495846e57
Co-Authored-By: Jay Dobies <jason.dobies@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add "sudo" to the instruction for running Kuryr

This patch adds "sudo" to "Running Kuryr" section of README.rst. Some
people get stuck with the errors of pyroute2 and that's because of the
lack of the privilege for manipulating the veth interfaces.

Related-Bug: #1516539

Change-Id: I44f44755a1aec4ec29d0afa4852e989eca28d381
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add documentation for configuring Keystone LDAP Identity back-ends

This patch adds documentation for the configuration of multiple

commit_message:
Add Zookeeper driver for DB

The devstack only supports ubuntu,
because I don't have other envs.

I'll update devstack scripts when I set
up other envs.

To solve the stateful client bug, lazy
initialization is introduced.

Change-Id: I3e74601f2b867b695578f18be2faf7efc33bc7aa
Implements: blueprint zookeeper-driver
Closes-Bug: #1534504

commit_message:
Add ECMP support config for PGLib

As a part of the Neutron ECMP support being added in the PLUMgrid plugin,
the new CLI for PGLib requires a configuration file pgrc
which is installed under /etc/neutron/plugins/plumgrid

Change-Id: I8a492655ff53099057e4648c9c835cd7ae4d0d2a
Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeriak@plumgrid.com>
(cherry picked from commit c7dc53bbe254763db2df9ba6aec69350316200c6)

commit_message:
Clean rabbitmq dump of auto-delete queues

This change adds a script that can be used on the output from the
rabbitmq admin plugin that dumps the rabbitmq definitions to a json
format. This script removes the auto-delete queues and cleans up any
references to them in the bindings and exchanges.

Change-Id: Ie3f3194b3eaaa8dc28d1cd3442090b586e177306
Closes-Bug: #1497961
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Mescheryakov <dmescheryakov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove DB calls from Pure Volume Driver CG methods

After the updates to the CG API’s to pass in the objects we didn’t need
to call the DB anymore. This finally fixes that issue and updates to
return the actual database updates.

Change-Id: If6c96843be1d7e1cbc83e4258b917296129df621
Closes-Bug: #1531676

when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our

commit_message:
use oslotest to break into the debugger when running test cases

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug" to debug test cases
when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our
test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.
usage link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Closes-bug: #1534030
Change-Id: Id04483d25a6dee6a6ed89193171f610a7f3bbfcf

commit_message:
Python3: replace dumps with dump_as_bytes

Use dump_as_bytes() to ensure that the result type is bytes
on Python 2 and Python 3.
ref:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.serialization/api.html#oslo_serialization.jsonutils.dumps

Partial-Implements: python3
Change-Id: I776e6cb2cc3ee3c003086c550fc8920e6f369c5d

commit_message:
Pick up proxy buildargs from environment

We currently support any buildarg via --build-args. This patch picks up
the default supported proxy buildargs if set in the user's environment,
to allow for more transparent proxy support.

The --build-args will take precendence.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint: better-proxy-support

Change-Id: I084e5d1cc8f9993d65167878f9983ad58a68e86e

subject: Make metadata_server_url config optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 17:50:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/heat_plugin.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/tests/clients/test_clients.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Make metadata_server_url config optional

Similar to If8a2d3f37d87c26228e709c20f61969b397f2da0 which made
the heat_waitcondition_server_url optional, this makes it possible
to not set the heat_waitcondition_server_url option in heat.conf,
and instead have heat derive it from the CFN endpoint in the
service catalog.

Arguably this is a more correct approach in the majority of cases, but
the config file overrides are maintained to enable environments which
require them to continue using them (such as where instances must
route requests to heat via a specific proxy not defined in the service
catalog).

Change-Id: Id402664e38e3da071ad634233b3a1f8e13af152d
'}]
commit_message:
Make metadata_server_url config optional

Similar to If8a2d3f37d87c26228e709c20f61969b397f2da0 which made
the heat_waitcondition_server_url optional, this makes it possible
to not set the heat_waitcondition_server_url option in heat.conf,
and instead have heat derive it from the CFN endpoint in the
service catalog.

Arguably this is a more correct approach in the majority of cases, but
the config file overrides are maintained to enable environments which
require them to continue using them (such as where instances must
route requests to heat via a specific proxy not defined in the service
catalog).

Change-Id: Id402664e38e3da071ad634233b3a1f8e13af152d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-26 08:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tenantvm_floatingip.yaml', 'scripts/tripleo.sh', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Adds a simple overcloud tenant vm ping test to tripleo.sh

As discussed at [1] this adds a simple overcloud tenant vm startup,
with a floating ip attached, which is then pinged. The goal is to
eventually add tempest support though consensus seems to be we should
carry at least a ping test.

This has now been re-implemented with a heat template, which we
carry here for now (but can be moved to a better place if necessary)

The aim here is to add this to tripleo.sh to it primarily will be
consumed by toci_instack for ci

[1] https://trello.com/c/OQlIbGoK/19-toci-start-a-user-instance-and-ping-it

Conflicts:
	scripts/tripleo.sh

Change-Id: Ifbbaf0a84dd9e0530fa8b9a42a0f66793e0df94d
(cherry-picked from commit dcc6739e2a81f186ace3df909e7f635751311ca1)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a simple overcloud tenant vm ping test to tripleo.sh

As discussed at [1] this adds a simple overcloud tenant vm startup,
with a floating ip attached, which is then pinged. The goal is to
eventually add tempest support though consensus seems to be we should
carry at least a ping test.

This has now been re-implemented with a heat template, which we
carry here for now (but can be moved to a better place if necessary)

The aim here is to add this to tripleo.sh to it primarily will be
consumed by toci_instack for ci

[1] https://trello.com/c/OQlIbGoK/19-toci-start-a-user-instance-and-ping-it

Conflicts:
	scripts/tripleo.sh

Change-Id: Ifbbaf0a84dd9e0530fa8b9a42a0f66793e0df94d
(cherry-picked from commit dcc6739e2a81f186ace3df909e7f635751311ca1)

commit_message:
configuration in tox.ini to break into the debugger when running tests

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug" to debug test cases
when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our
test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.
usage link:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I7a74fef2be44aec10f460b42be16f796d61a022a

subject: Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-08 05:02:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
 of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)
so its usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: Idb1f8457c108b690b2361ef50c22bd47614cfd11
'}]
commit_message:
Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
 of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)
so its usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: Idb1f8457c108b690b2361ef50c22bd47614cfd11

commit_message:
Clean up flake8 ignore list

We bump hacking>=0.10.0, and hacking removed some rules,
for the full list of rules please see [1]. So don't need them any more.

Meantime, There is no bad code violating rules E123 and E125.
So clean the ignore list to do a more strict check.

[1]https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg#L30

Change-Id: I1d084e41c2b428973a7fcbc446dd7a7a3476f4f6

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug"
to debug test cases when tox is running.
Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.

ref:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/debugging.html

Change-Id: Ifb17381938baf359d634614d0d89f4eb9d479bc4
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug"
to debug test cases when tox is running.
Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our test cases.

Only we should do is insert pdb into code.It's easy to use.

ref:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/debugging.html

Change-Id: Ifb17381938baf359d634614d0d89f4eb9d479bc4

commit_message:
Remove LinuxBridge manager get_local_ip_device arg

The local_ip method argument is unnecessary since the local_ip field of
the linux bridge manager is already accessible and get_local_ip_device()
is not used by any external callers.

commit_message:
Add Distributed DNAT spec

This adds a spec describing the changes needed
to be done in Dragonflow pipeline in order to support
distributed DNAT (Floating IP).

blueprint fip-distribution

Add retry logic for removing a disk device from the LibVirt
guest domain XML. This is needed because immediately after a guest
reboot, libvirtmod.virDomainDetachDeviceFlags() will silently fail
to remove the mapping from the guest domain. The async retry
behavior is done in Guest and is generic so it can be re-used by any other
detaches which hit this same race condition.

Change-Id: I983f80822a5c210929f33e1aa348a0fef91e890b
Closes-Bug: #1374508
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry logic for detaching device using LibVirt

Add retry logic for removing a disk device from the LibVirt
guest domain XML. This is needed because immediately after a guest
reboot, libvirtmod.virDomainDetachDeviceFlags() will silently fail
to remove the mapping from the guest domain. The async retry
behavior is done in Guest and is generic so it can be re-used by any other
detaches which hit this same race condition.

Change-Id: I983f80822a5c210929f33e1aa348a0fef91e890b
Closes-Bug: #1374508

subject: Allow sourcing apt_key from ansible host or URL
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-26 10:30:16.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Allow sourcing apt_key from ansible host or URL

This change allows deployers to specify locally sourced apt keys
on the ansible host or URL rather than requiring all apt keys to
be downloaded from upstream keyservers.

The current implementation requires that all containers and hosts
we deploy to have an internet connection to download apt keys for
the various repos. This change allows the user to source apt keys
from the deployment host like for example:

galera_gpg_keys:
  - key_name: 'mariadb'
    data: "{{ lookup('file', '/etc/openstack_deploy/keys/mariadb.gpg') }}"
    hash_id: '0xcbcb082a1bb943db'
  - key_name: 'percona-xtrabackup'
    keyserver: 'hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80'
    fallback_keyserver: 'hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80'
    hash_id: '0x1c4cbdcdcd2efd2a'

Note: Deployers can already set the repo URLs to use local sources,
so this enables fully offline package installation.

Change-Id: I4ffd1100f0c79f1611f056f6002d1ba4610323d3
'}]
commit_message:
Allow sourcing apt_key from ansible host or URL

This change allows deployers to specify locally sourced apt keys
on the ansible host or URL rather than requiring all apt keys to
be downloaded from upstream keyservers.

The current implementation requires that all containers and hosts
we deploy to have an internet connection to download apt keys for
the various repos. This change allows the user to source apt keys
from the deployment host like for example:

galera_gpg_keys:
  - key_name: 'mariadb'
    data: "{{ lookup('file', '/etc/openstack_deploy/keys/mariadb.gpg') }}"
    hash_id: '0xcbcb082a1bb943db'
  - key_name: 'percona-xtrabackup'
    keyserver: 'hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80'
    fallback_keyserver: 'hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80'
    hash_id: '0x1c4cbdcdcd2efd2a'

Note: Deployers can already set the repo URLs to use local sources,
so this enables fully offline package installation.

Change-Id: I4ffd1100f0c79f1611f056f6002d1ba4610323d3

commit_message:
Add redirect stout/stderr for nailgun units.

Due to systemd has not native support to output stderr/stdout from service to file, we need to run it by executing bash with redirection.

Related-Bug: #1523476

Change-Id: I83585278b5c7aad1e8f8a21679d9d5b095b1bdad

Add ECMP support config for PGLib

As a part of the Neutron ECMP support being added in the PLUMgrid plugin,
the new CLI for PGLib requires a configuration file pgrc
which is installed under /etc/neutron/plugins/plumgrid

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 03:07:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Switch verify_tempest_config to use tempest cmd

Now verify-tempest-config of tempest tox is deprecated, and the log
of devstack contains the following deprecation message:

  Use of: 'verify-tempest-config' is deprecated,
  please use: 'tempest verify-config'

That message makes us confusion for investigating the other problem,
so this patch makes lib/tempest switch to use 'tempest verify-config'.

Change-Id: I59185e886a8fd2884bc7a16c261f1fbbe13a6b7a
"}]
commit_message:
Switch verify_tempest_config to use tempest cmd

Now verify-tempest-config of tempest tox is deprecated, and the log
of devstack contains the following deprecation message:

  Use of: 'verify-tempest-config' is deprecated,
  please use: 'tempest verify-config'

That message makes us confusion for investigating the other problem,
so this patch makes lib/tempest switch to use 'tempest verify-config'.

Change-Id: I59185e886a8fd2884bc7a16c261f1fbbe13a6b7a

subject: Use BSD's 'sed' regexp on MacOSX
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 09:57:43.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbox/functions/vm.sh', 'virtualbox/functions/network.sh'], 'message': "Use BSD's 'sed' regexp on MacOSX

VirtualBox scripts tested well only with GNU version of the
'sed', but MacOSX systems without custom brew-installed
packages contain BSD's version of the sed. This commit
fixes regexp to use both versions.

Change-Id: I058cac4eb9c2beefffc20ad05a47bc1d8ed2169d
(cherry-pick from commit 41be14eab811d37bd83df7cf2962d93a433e5fea)
Closes-Bug: #1537822
"}]
commit_message:
Use BSD's 'sed' regexp on MacOSX

VirtualBox scripts tested well only with GNU version of the
'sed', but MacOSX systems without custom brew-installed
packages contain BSD's version of the sed. This commit
fixes regexp to use both versions.

Change-Id: I058cac4eb9c2beefffc20ad05a47bc1d8ed2169d
(cherry-pick from commit 41be14eab811d37bd83df7cf2962d93a433e5fea)
Closes-Bug: #1537822

subject: Improve Tempest credential provider usage
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-22 20:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/test_bay.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/test_baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/common/base.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Improve Tempest credential provider usage

Instead of getting a DynamicCredentialProvider directly, use the
get_credentials_provider function. This allows for configuration via
TEMPEST_ variables, but the default will still be dynamic credentials.
Only create the default keypair for tests if it doesn't already exist.
Ensure that credentials are freed by calling clear_creds in all cases.

Change-Id: I62ad5ed9fe7c9f6675989df459f92194bb8d67a8
Implements: blueprint magnum-tempest
"}]
commit_message:
Improve Tempest credential provider usage

Instead of getting a DynamicCredentialProvider directly, use the
get_credentials_provider function. This allows for configuration via
TEMPEST_ variables, but the default will still be dynamic credentials.
Only create the default keypair for tests if it doesn't already exist.
Ensure that credentials are freed by calling clear_creds in all cases.

Change-Id: I62ad5ed9fe7c9f6675989df459f92194bb8d67a8
Implements: blueprint magnum-tempest

subject: Revert "fixed_network should be fixed_network_cidr"
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-25 02:32:13.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_k8s_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_mesos_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/conductor/template_definition.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_swarm_bay_conductor.py'], 'message': 'Revert "fixed_network should be fixed_network_cidr"

Originally BayModel#fixed_network was used for setting which
fixed_network was set to Bay [1].
But this attribute changed to setting fixed_network_cidr [2].
This patch removes mapping for fixed_network_cidr.

And also, fixed_network_cidr attribute will be add to
baymodel [3].

Magnum user want to specify fixed_network for bay, so I'll add
a  mapping to template definition to set fixed_network
next patch.

commit_message:
Revert "fixed_network should be fixed_network_cidr"

Originally BayModel#fixed_network was used for setting which
fixed_network was set to Bay [1].
But this attribute changed to setting fixed_network_cidr [2].
This patch removes mapping for fixed_network_cidr.

And also, fixed_network_cidr attribute will be add to
baymodel [3].

Magnum user want to specify fixed_network for bay, so I'll add
a  mapping to template definition to set fixed_network
next patch.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/bc3bc6190d35e9236919b9e7beda9ff00a309101/magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_k8s_heat.py#L101
[2]: I624b95930f9eb506abfb2e29beea8d83878ea142
[3]: Ia74ed924b3058b4891775f34f1b9624774c02ddb

Change-Id: Ia9820213bcc0e2a451450dd014e774843b881fd1
Closes-Bug: #1536484

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 08:31:08.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Improve OCF script diagnostics for timed-out 'list_channels'

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/563

Currently time-out when running 'rabbitmqctl list_channels' is treated
as a sign that current node is unhealthy. But it could not be the
case, as the hanging channel could be actually on some other
node. Given that currently we have seen more than one bug related to
'list_channels', it makes sense to improve diagnostics here.

This patch doesn't change any behaviour, only improves logging after
time-out happens. If time-outs continue to occur (even with latest
rabbitmq versions or with backported fixes), we could switch to this
improved list_channels and kill rabbitmq only if stuck channels are
located on current node. But I hope that all related rabbitmq bugs
were already closed.

Change-Id: I4746d3a4e85dc2a51af581034ae09a1cf0eefce2
Partial-Bug: #1515223
Partial-Bug: #1513511
"}]
commit_message:
Improve OCF script diagnostics for timed-out 'list_channels'

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/563

Currently time-out when running 'rabbitmqctl list_channels' is treated
as a sign that current node is unhealthy. But it could not be the
case, as the hanging channel could be actually on some other
node. Given that currently we have seen more than one bug related to
'list_channels', it makes sense to improve diagnostics here.

This patch doesn't change any behaviour, only improves logging after
time-out happens. If time-outs continue to occur (even with latest
rabbitmq versions or with backported fixes), we could switch to this
improved list_channels and kill rabbitmq only if stuck channels are
located on current node. But I hope that all related rabbitmq bugs
were already closed.

Change-Id: I4746d3a4e85dc2a51af581034ae09a1cf0eefce2
Partial-Bug: #1515223
Partial-Bug: #1513511

subject: API hanged on a termination signal
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-25 15:52:14.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "API hanged on a termination signal

When murano-api is running with several api worker threads sending it a
termination signal (SIGTERM, SIGHUP or SIGINT) leads to waitall()
being called inside a GreenPool's greenthread. The reason is that a
wsgi server is started in a green thread from the same green pool that
is passed to the server itself to be used for spawning client green
threads. To avoid it, it is reasonable to use different pools for
spawning a wsgi server and for its internal usage.

Closes-Bug: #1536666
Change-Id: Ib8c9609035a5585b0392811ebd9de669dbc0c986
"}]
commit_message:
API hanged on a termination signal

When murano-api is running with several api worker threads sending it a
termination signal (SIGTERM, SIGHUP or SIGINT) leads to waitall()
being called inside a GreenPool's greenthread. The reason is that a
wsgi server is started in a green thread from the same green pool that
is passed to the server itself to be used for spawning client green
threads. To avoid it, it is reasonable to use different pools for
spawning a wsgi server and for its internal usage.

Closes-Bug: #1536666
Change-Id: Ib8c9609035a5585b0392811ebd9de669dbc0c986

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

commit_message:
Add new django extraction

- Create a new extract_django function that can be used
  for all django repositories.
- Create a new setup_django function to setup translation server
  for django repositories.
- Create a new propose_django function to propose translations.
- Extra a module name from setup.cfg.

Use these functions for murano-dashboard.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I75c61ca709e05740c8932218b132752828b90b91
Story: 2000452

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-25 17:00:44.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbox/functions/vm.sh', 'virtualbox/functions/network.sh'], 'message': "Use BSD's 'sed' regexp on MacOSX

VirtualBox scripts tested well only with GNU version of the
'sed', but MacOSX systems without custom brew-installed
packages contain BSD's version of the sed. This commit
fixes regexp to use both versions.

Change-Id: I058cac4eb9c2beefffc20ad05a47bc1d8ed2169d
Closes-Bug: #1537822
"}]
commit_message:
Use BSD's 'sed' regexp on MacOSX

VirtualBox scripts tested well only with GNU version of the
'sed', but MacOSX systems without custom brew-installed
packages contain BSD's version of the sed. This commit
fixes regexp to use both versions.

Change-Id: I058cac4eb9c2beefffc20ad05a47bc1d8ed2169d
Closes-Bug: #1537822

subject: Update server metadata before updating node/cluster properties
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-26 09:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py'], 'message': 'Update server metadata before updating node/cluster properties

When add/del nodes from a cluster, nova server metadata should be
updated earlier than node/cluster properties update. In case
node/cluster properties update is succeeded but server meatadata
update failed which will cause inconsistency of cluster-show and
cluster-node-list.
This patch also fixes a bug when an orphan node leaves a cluster.

Change-Id: Ie10680f102a5856dad53c97bd2b0b54156602197
'}]
commit_message:
Update server metadata before updating node/cluster properties

When add/del nodes from a cluster, nova server metadata should be
updated earlier than node/cluster properties update. In case
node/cluster properties update is succeeded but server meatadata
update failed which will cause inconsistency of cluster-show and
cluster-node-list.
This patch also fixes a bug when an orphan node leaves a cluster.

Change-Id: Ie10680f102a5856dad53c97bd2b0b54156602197

subject: Fix zuul cloner macro for requirements repo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 11:59:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': "Fix zuul cloner macro for requirements repo

When using zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints on things like the pep8 job
for requirements, we end up producing a zuul cloner file that
references openstack/requirements twice. Zuul cloner is sad when this
happens.

As a work around, just don't added requirements. Indentation here is
important, which is why the shell looks a little wonky.

Change-Id: I3d81c8d3cf654f0e1d50b7d59856335d6b182222
"}]
commit_message:
Fix zuul cloner macro for requirements repo

When using zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints on things like the pep8 job
for requirements, we end up producing a zuul cloner file that
references openstack/requirements twice. Zuul cloner is sad when this
happens.

As a work around, just don't added requirements. Indentation here is
important, which is why the shell looks a little wonky.

Change-Id: I3d81c8d3cf654f0e1d50b7d59856335d6b182222

commit_message:
Fix duplicated parameters

With the update to puppet 4.3.2, the puppet 4 syntax jobs will fail if
parameters are duplicated. This change removes the duplicated parameters
which should fix the syntax job.

Change-Id: I8b8cdc75d2311bc37e9cf04c0d42a1f70edecf20
Closes-Bug: #1537905

commit_message:
Fix chicken and eggs problem with tripleo-heat-templates

There is a current effort on tripleo-heat-templates to manage keystone
resources directly via puppet. The effort is separate in two patchset
one to replace the current keystone.initialize() and the other other to
replace setup-endpoints().

This review is necessary in order to make CI pass the upstream jobs.
The whole keystone functions call will be removed then.

Change-Id: Ia4b3244f114dcff746ab89d355ad4933f8fdbddf
(cherry picked from commit 584c95f36ac07e425fa7dab6e844c6de731628a5)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-22 13:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['doc/base_tests.rst', 'fuelweb_test/run_tests.py', 'gates_tests/tests/test_review_in_astute.py', 'gates_tests/helpers/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add gate test for Astute

Add gate test for Astute that should be executed for each review in openstack/fuel-astute repo.

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=True
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/rpm/to/be/downloaded

Test depends on ready_with_3_slaves, so it is better to run it with -k/-K options.

Scenario:

    1. Revert environment ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Upload package
    3. Update Astute rpm package from review
    4. Update network configuration
    5. Create env
    6. Update nodes with roles: controller, compute, cinder
    7. Deploy cluster
    8. Start ostf tests to check that changes do not reproduce regression

Change-Id: I4de4513e0f9186fda8750a74b44b5cff0edfbc21
'}]
commit_message:
Add gate test for Astute

Add gate test for Astute that should be executed for each review in openstack/fuel-astute repo.

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=True
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/rpm/to/be/downloaded

Test depends on ready_with_3_slaves, so it is better to run it with -k/-K options.

Scenario:

    1. Revert environment ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Upload package
    3. Update Astute rpm package from review
    4. Update network configuration
    5. Create env
    6. Update nodes with roles: controller, compute, cinder
    7. Deploy cluster
    8. Start ostf tests to check that changes do not reproduce regression

Change-Id: I4de4513e0f9186fda8750a74b44b5cff0edfbc21

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore,
remove it from requirements.
This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib6ded725ef233ab2725ac2788aed0366504ed22a

subject: Prevent unexpected erasing nodes during image based provision
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8358, 'name': 'zhangguoqing', 'email': 'zhang.guoqing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhangguoqing'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12559, 'name': 'Valyavskiy Viacheslav', 'email': 'vvalyavskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vvalyavskiy'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-08 08:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': "Prevent unexpected erasing nodes during image based provision

Classic provisioning flow:

bootstrap -> erase -> reboot -> provisioning (node do not respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

If system is backed online via mcollective and return bootstrap status, it will be erased.

Image flow before this change:

bootstrap -> erase -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

Sometimes we can ask nodes about status in case of image flow
before they will be rebooted. And send them to erase if they are answered 'bootstrap'. To prevent such situation, we add
new systemtype 'image'.

Now workflow will be looked:

bootstrap -> erase -> image -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

We marked nodes with 'image' systemtype as not provisioned, but do not try to erase them.

This new type should not block any other operations with node:

* delete;
* stop provisioning;
* reprovisioning.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Rostecki <mrostecki@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7fcc32c604526575d7805386ecfe3d0d40cbd12e
Closes-Bug: #1427718
(cherry picked from commit 0bcc91185984a1f9e4bd68d9f247266c35349dae)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent unexpected erasing nodes during image based provision

Classic provisioning flow:

bootstrap -> erase -> reboot -> provisioning (node do not respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

If system is backed online via mcollective and return bootstrap status, it will be erased.

Image flow before this change:

bootstrap -> erase -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

Sometimes we can ask nodes about status in case of image flow
before they will be rebooted. And send them to erase if they are answered 'bootstrap'. To prevent such situation, we add
new systemtype 'image'.

Now workflow will be looked:

bootstrap -> erase -> image -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

We marked nodes with 'image' systemtype as not provisioned, but do not try to erase them.

This new type should not block any other operations with node:

* delete;
* stop provisioning;
* reprovisioning.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Rostecki <mrostecki@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7fcc32c604526575d7805386ecfe3d0d40cbd12e
Closes-Bug: #1427718
(cherry picked from commit 0bcc91185984a1f9e4bd68d9f247266c35349dae)

commit_message:
Prevent unexpected erasing nodes during image based provision

Classic provisioning flow:

bootstrap -> erase -> reboot -> provisioning (node do not respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

If system is backed online via mcollective and return bootstrap status, it will be erased.

Image flow before this change:

bootstrap -> erase -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

Sometimes we can ask nodes about status in case of image flow
before they will be rebooted. And send them to erase if they are answered 'bootstrap'. To prevent such situation, we add
new systemtype 'image'.

Now workflow will be looked:

bootstrap -> erase -> image -> provisioning (node still can respond via mcollective) -> reboot -> target

We marked nodes with 'image' systemtype as not provisioned, but do not try to erase them.

This new type should not block any other operations with node:

* delete;
* stop provisioning;
* reprovisioning.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Rostecki <mrostecki@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7fcc32c604526575d7805386ecfe3d0d40cbd12e
Closes-Bug: #1427718

subject: Fix some dict sorting problems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 13:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/policies/deletion_policy.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_deletion_policy.py'], 'message': 'Fix some dict sorting problems

There are cases we iterate a dict and do testing according to the
results. Dict is itself not ordered, so this is making a definite
testing very difficult. This patch reworks the logic to make the results
predictable.

Change-Id: I60da8c953b5c8e5d155ebcec44285c5e88c214aa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some dict sorting problems

There are cases we iterate a dict and do testing according to the
results. Dict is itself not ordered, so this is making a definite
testing very difficult. This patch reworks the logic to make the results
predictable.

Change-Id: I60da8c953b5c8e5d155ebcec44285c5e88c214aa

subject: Fix cluster-node-add bug caused by 'None' custer_id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-26 04:15:37.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py'], 'message': "Fix cluster-node-add bug caused by 'None' custer_id

Now in senlin a node's cluster_id is configured to '' if
it does not belong to any cluster. This will cause a bug
when adding this node to a cluster. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ia23e10b23a8f9e6d08d1630bbba884d8a696b99c
Closes-bug: #1537968
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster-node-add bug caused by 'None' custer_id

Now in senlin a node's cluster_id is configured to '' if
it does not belong to any cluster. This will cause a bug
when adding this node to a cluster. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ia23e10b23a8f9e6d08d1630bbba884d8a696b99c
Closes-bug: #1537968

in version pinning.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 14:44:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'cleanup: collapse wsgi serializer test hierarchy

There previously was a serializer / deserializer hierarchy because the
XML serializers shared some content with JSON ones, but not all. Now
that XML is out of the tree, this is an extra level of class hierarchy
for no reason.

Collapse the hierarchy, remove the 2 tests that were testing the base
classes (which were not used anywhere in functional code).

Change-Id: Iba739a4081f6dd8d6919a27e0ad61a38c33f1525
'}]
commit_message:
cleanup: collapse wsgi serializer test hierarchy

There previously was a serializer / deserializer hierarchy because the
XML serializers shared some content with JSON ones, but not all. Now
that XML is out of the tree, this is an extra level of class hierarchy
for no reason.

Collapse the hierarchy, remove the 2 tests that were testing the base
classes (which were not used anywhere in functional code).

Change-Id: Iba739a4081f6dd8d6919a27e0ad61a38c33f1525

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-25 21:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Convert available and minimum disk sizes to bytes.

Previously the check-requirements role would assume GB as the unit
of space when gathering disk sizes from ansible_devices. With
drives larger than 1 TB ansible_devices reports the size as a
float. This converts all disk sizes to bytes for consistency within
the comparisons regardless of the size of the disk.

Closes-Bug: 1536726
'}]
commit_message:
Convert available and minimum disk sizes to bytes.

Previously the check-requirements role would assume GB as the unit
of space when gathering disk sizes from ansible_devices. With
drives larger than 1 TB ansible_devices reports the size as a
float. This converts all disk sizes to bytes for consistency within
the comparisons regardless of the size of the disk.

Change-Id: I07b81a8a35197f73cd338fa02cb7b112df15a012
Closes-Bug: 1536726

commit_message:
Handle NotFound in Stack get_all

As we don't have transactions and we're loading the templates
seperately, they can be gone by the time we load the stack. Let's ignore
NotFound errors in that case.

Change-Id: I048b4fb50512478a514f245b618784f1d7eb0c1d
Closes-Bug: #1537627

commit_message:
Add service status notification

When the status of the Service object is changed
nova will send a new service.update notification
with versioned payload according to bp versioned-notification-api

For example
  nova service-disable --reason 'my reason' controller nova-compute
will generate the following notification
{
    "priority":"INFO",
    "event_type":"service.update",
    "timestamp":"2015-11-13 11:12:04.211575",
    "publisher_id":"nova-compute:controller",
    "payload":{
        "nova_object.version":"1.0",
        "nova_object.name":"ServiceStatusPayload",
        "nova_object.namespace":"nova",
        "nova_object.data":{
            "binary":"nova-compute",
            "report_count":1,
            "topic":"compute",
            "host":"controller",
            "version":2,
            "disabled":true,
            "forced_down":false,
            "last_seen_up":"2015-11-12T13:46:25Z",
            "disabled_reason":"my reason",
        }
    },
    "message_id":"8516b5c7-c6a7-43a4-9ad1-df447f318afb"
}

Implements: bp service-status-notification
Change-Id: I82f1935eaf55220bf261d8b8240fd35d822c9404

commit_message:
Remove redundant _stack_rand_name from func tests

Base HeatIntegrationTest class uses _stack_rand_name method in
stack_create method, so redundant using of _stack_rand_name should be removed
in tests, where:
 1. stacks.create method is not called directly
 2. stacks_name is not used later in the test
